user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 is: Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of send_chat_page:
```c
static enum MHD_Result
send_chat_page (struct MHD_Connection *con)
{
  struct MHD_Response *res;
  enum MHD_Result ret;

  res = MHD_create_response_from_buffer_static (strlen (CHAT_PAGE),
                                                (const void *) CHAT_PAGE);
  ret = MHD_queue_response (con, MHD_HTTP_OK, res);
  MHD_destroy_response (res);
  return ret;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
res = MHD_create_response_from_buffer_static (strlen (CHAT_PAGE),
                                                (const void *) CHAT_PAGE);
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 17.2 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation: the fragment calls MHD_create_response_from_buffer_static and does not call send_chat_page (there is no direct or indirect recursion shown). A Rule 17.2 violation would occur only if one of the called functions (e.g. MHD_create_response_from_buffer_static or MHD_queue_response) were to call back to send_chat_page (directly or through a chain of calls), which is not evidenced here.
